title: Build a free Physics Wallah-like exam-prep website (no paid courses)

requirements.text: Create a PW-like exam-prep web app experience where all courses are free (no pricing, checkout, subscriptions, or payment flows anywhere in the UI).

quotes: Give m complete code for creating Physics Wallah app like website but there is no paid course all are free

acceptanceCriteria: No UI pages/components for payments (pricing tables, checkout, subscriptions) are present.
All course/lesson access is available without paywalls.

requirements.text: Implement the core information architecture and navigation for an exam-prep platform: Home, Courses, Course Detail, Subject/Chapter listing, Lesson/Content viewer, and a global search page.

quotes: creating Physics Wallah app like website

acceptanceCriteria: Users can navigate from Home -> Courses -> Course Detail -> Lesson Viewer without dead ends.
A global search UI can find courses/chapters/lessons by keyword and show results.

requirements.text: Define and implement a backend data model in the single Motoko actor to represent free content: Course, Subject, Chapter, Lesson, and resource links (e.g., video URL, PDF URL/filename). Provide query methods to list/search and fetch details.

quotes: complete code for creating Physics Wallah app like website

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes methods to: listCourses, getCourse(courseId), listSubjects, listChapters(subjectId), getChapter(chapterId), getLesson(lessonId), and search(query).
All methods are query calls where appropriate and return stable, typed results usable by the frontend actor client.

requirements.text: Seed the backend with a small but realistic starter catalog for NEET/JEE-style prep (at minimum Physics, Chemistry, Maths, Biology) including at least: 4 courses, 8 chapters, and 16 lessons, with a mix of video links and downloadable resources.
acceptanceCriteria: On first deploy, the app shows non-empty course listings without requiring any admin data entry.
Seed data includes PCMB coverage and multiple lessons per subject.

requirements.text: Build a Lesson/Content Viewer page that can render: embedded video (via URL), structured notes (rich text blocks), and a resources section with downloadable static PDFs (served from frontend public assets).
acceptanceCriteria: If a lesson has a video URL, the page shows an embedded player area.
If a lesson has notes, they render with headings, lists, and emphasis.
If a lesson has resources, users can download/open them from the UI (static assets, not streamed through the backend).

requirements.text: Add basic anonymous progress tracking in the frontend (local-only) so users can mark lessons as completed and see completion status at chapter and course level.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can mark/unmark a lesson complete.
Chapter and course pages display completion counts (e.g., 5/12 lessons completed).
Progress persists across reloads using browser storage (no login required).

requirements.text: Use React Query for all backend reads (course lists, detail fetches, search) with loading, empty, and error states implemented consistently across pages.
acceptanceCriteria: All server data fetching uses React Query hooks.
Every page that fetches data displays a clear loading state and a clear empty state.

requirements.text: Create a coherent, modern visual theme suitable for an exam-prep brand (distinctive colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and apply it consistently across the entire app. Avoid blue & purple as primary colors.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across Home, Courses, Detail, Search, and Lesson pages.
Primary palette is not blue/purple-dominant.
UI is responsive for mobile and desktop (no horizontal overflow, navigable on small screens).

requirements.text: Add a lightweight, user-facing legal/footer section with English-only text: ‘All courses are free’ notice, a basic disclaimer, and contact placeholder information.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer appears site-wide and includes ‘All courses are free’ text.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Add static example resources (PDFs) to the frontend public assets and wire them into at least 4 seeded lessons as downloadable resources.
acceptanceCriteria: At least 4 lessons show downloadable PDF resources.
PDFs are served as static files from the frontend (not fetched from Motoko).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).

Do not edit files under frontend immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
All user-facing text must be in English.
No paid course functionality: no payments, subscriptions, checkout, or pricing/paywall gating.
Do not introduce external databases or third-party auth; Internet Identity is allowed but not required for this request.
nonGoals: Implementing live classes, real-time chat, or WebSocket-based features.
Building a creator/admin CMS with role-based publishing workflows.
Integrating third-party video hosting APIs beyond embedding via URL.
Generating full NCERT notes/MCQs for every chapter (content generation at that scale is out of scope for this build).

required: Wordmark logo in a clean academic style (logo-wordmark.dim_1200x300.png)
App icon with an academic/exam-prep motif (app-icon.dim_512x512.png)
Hero banner illustration with students/books/physics-chemistry-math-biology elements in a modern flat style (hero-banner.dim_1600x600.png)

Four subject icons in a consistent style: Physics, Chemistry, Maths, Biology (icon-physics.dim_256x256.png) (icon-chemistry.dim_256x256.png) (icon-maths.dim_256x256.png) (icon-biology.dim_256x256.png)
